definitions.definition: A workers' council , an institution first formed during the 1905 Russian Revolution and then instituted as the main form of communist government at all levels in the Soviet Union ; by extension, a similar organization in early Chinese communism and elsewhere.

main_definition: ( historical ) A workers' council , an institution first formed during the 1905 Russian Revolution and then instituted as the main form of communist government at all levels in the Soviet Union ; by extension, a similar organization in early Chinese communism and elsewhere.
